artist: Artist: Wenceslaus Hollar; Artist: After a follower of Hans Holbein the Younger
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: three men entering the gate of a crude picket fence, carrying staffs with crosses; one man points towards Jesus who is on his knees with his hands raised in front of a cave at URC; cartouche in clouds shows a dead Christ with crucifix
inscription:
Inscription

lettered in plate at bottom center: [H. Holbein inu]

inscribed in plate at bottom: [The Traitor Judas, doth his Lord betraie / While in the Garden hee alone doth praie / And a rude rabble, like himself, hee brings / Of Traitors, for to take the King of Kinges] 

numbered in plate at lower right: [1]
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Juli; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Christ on the Mount of Olives, From the Satirical Passion
